title: U.S. students who have used hallucinogenic drugs 2017
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 3 different Sexs for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic that are presented on the X-axis.
Sex Male had the maximum Share of students among all 4 groups, and it was for Hispanic. The minimum Share of students was observed in Sex Female for Black (non-Hispanic).
Among all the Sexs, All races / ethnicities had the highest Share of students 76.0 in Sex Male and lowest value 55.0 in Sex Female.
Sex Male and Female had the biggest gap of 21.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for All races / ethnicities.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 3 different Sexs for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic that are presented on the X-axis.
Sex Male had the maximum Share of students among all 4 groups, and it was for Hispanic. The minimum Share of students was observed in Sex Female for Black (non-Hispanic).
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 3 different Sexs for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic that are presented on the X-axis.
Sex Male had the maximum Share of students among all 4 groups, and it was for Hispanic. The minimum Share of students was observed in Sex Female for Black (non-Hispanic).
Among all the Sexs, All races / ethnicities had the highest Share of students 76.0 in Sex Male and lowest value 55.0 in Sex Female.
Sex Male and Female had the biggest gap of 21.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for All races / ethnicities.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 3 different Sexs for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 4 groups, Hispanic had the highest Share of students in Sex Male and Black (non-Hispanic) had the lowest Share of students in Sex Female.
In Sex Male, All races / ethnicities had the maximum Share of students and it saw the lowest in Sex Female out of all 3 Sexs.
Sex Male and Female had the biggest gap of 21.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for All races / ethnicities.
Among the groups, Black (non-Hispanic) had the biggest difference in Share of students. Where the maximum Share of students was 3.43 times larger than the minimum Share of students.
Hispanic had the maximum Share of students out of all 4 groups in Sex Male followed by Hispanic in Male, and the minimum Share of students is found for Black (non-Hispanic) in Female.
Averaging all 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic, the Sex Male is the maximum Share of students and Female is the minimum Share of students.
